result.execSummary:
The defendant Myron M. Waite was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Myron M. Waite

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

ADDRESS INFO for Myron M. Waite
Current: 523 Bundy St, Ironwood, MI 49938 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2016)
Prior: 1801 Superior Street, Three Lakes, WI 54562

10:20 a.m. Defendant Myron M. Waite in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Court imposes fine of $100 plus costs for a total of $579.00. Provide DNA Sample.   The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4). Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given. Adj. 10:30 a.m.  Review hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 24, 2016 at 10:15 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:29 p.m. Defendant Myron M. Waite in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

2:07 p.m. Defendant Myron M. Waite in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 2:14 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
